learning_objectives.description: Use and interpret the following geometrical terms: point, vertex, line, plane, parallel, perpendicular, perpendicular bisector, bearing, right angle, acute, obtuse and reflex angles, interior and exterior angles, similar, congruent, scale factor.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Candidates are not expected to show that two shapes are congruent.

learning_objectives.description: Use and interpret the vocabulary of: triangles, special quadrilaterals, polygons, nets, solids.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Includes the following terms. Triangles: equilateral, isosceles, scalene, right-angled. Quadrilaterals: square, rectangle, kite, rhombus, parallelogram, trapezium.

learning_objectives.description: Use and interpret the vocabulary of a circle.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Polygons: regular and irregular polygons, pentagon, hexagon, octagon, decagon. Solids: cube, cuboid, prism, cylinder, pyramid, cone, sphere, hemisphere, frustum, face, surface, edge. Includes the following terms: centre, radius (plural radii), diameter, circumference, semicircle, chord, tangent, major and minor arc, sector, segment.
